title: 111_s2901
content: The Act titled "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the long-term improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce. The program aims to develop new acquisition leaders, recruit individuals with outstanding skills, and offer advancement opportunities. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to meet the acquisition needs of the Federal Government. The program offers opportunities for advancement, competitive compensation, and leadership roles at executive agencies. The program includes contracts with qualified universities for training, consisting of one year of full-time on-campus training followed by two years of on-the-job and part-time training towards a Masters degree in related fields. The curriculum includes specific elements. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program offers opportunities for advancement, competitive compensation, and leadership roles at executive agencies. The curriculum includes rotational assignments at multiple agencies, non-agency-specific training courses, and emphasis on transparency and accountability. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program prioritizes transparency, accountability, and integrity in the public contracting process. Graduates receive priority for employment in executive agencies at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels based on performance and qualifications. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program allows graduates to advance to GS-12, 13, or 14 levels in executive agencies. The program limits the number of participants to 200 per year, with a minimum of 50 in the first year and increasing to 150 thereafter. The Administrator must collaborate with qualified universities to implement the program effectively. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program requires collaboration with universities for program administration, participant selection, and oversight. Participants must commit to federal employment upon graduation. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program requires participants to commit to federal employment in the field of acquisition for a minimum term of one year for each year in the program. Candidates who do not fulfill the service requirements must reimburse the Federal Government for funds received. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States for the program's operations and expenses, including tuition, books, materials, room and board, and travel. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program Fund covers expenses for students enrolled in the program, including travel, stipends, planning, administration, and other necessary costs as determined by the Administrator. The Fund is funded by appropriations or other sources. The Government-wide acquisition management fellows program under section 45 of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act requires the Administrator to submit an initial report within 120 days of enactment and annual reports thereafter to congressional committees. The reports will include a description of the program, activities, and budget needed. The Administrator must submit reports to congressional committees on the Government-wide acquisition management fellows program. The reports should include a description of program activities, effectiveness assessment, and recommendations for legislative or administrative actions. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to the Committee on Homeland Security. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund includes $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2011, $32,000,000 for fiscal year 2012, and $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2013. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific Senate and House committees.
